ygData.subject: Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: Grukklukk still having NO problems wit them blues...me still able to take them whites most of the time without any problems.  At this lvl (15) I can solo a
ygData.messageBody:
Grukklukk still having NO problems wit them blues...me still able to take
them whites most of the time without any problems. At this lvl (15) I can
solo a Dervish Thug (cons white) and need no help 9 out of 10 times. Now
them Derv Mojo Casters...them a different story! I can still take them once
in a while, but I usually need some helps right at the end of the fight.
BTW, I took a rather unique approach when I started this troll....put my
pints into DEX...and it does seem to work! I figured with my high base STR
I would already do quite a bit of damage, so I was looking for a way to
increase the frequency of my HITS.
Works for me!
Grukklukk da basher, lvl 15 Troll on Bristlebane

-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 10:37 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors


From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>


I think the end result to this argument is that the warrior will not be able
to level without a group at higher levels.

Is that what everyone else gets out of it? We can take tons of damage but
simply can't dish out enough compared to mages. I know that alot of blues
start to give warriors trouble in the level 15 range....although we can kill
them they hit alot more often than blues did at lower levels. Sometimes I
get lucky and can kill it with only losing a single bubble of health, other
times I am down to one or two bubbles and I have to go "buttdown" for 15
minutes or so before I can get back into action. I assume that as I get
higher in level it will only get worse. Any comments?

Also, is there a magic item that gives any kind of regen ability? Like a
ring of regeneration that would allow me to rest up hit points like a troll.
Or as if a bard was playing their regen song. I know about the bark potions
but at my current level they are to expensive for practical use.

Bael
(still) Warrior of the 15th Rank, Indigo Brotherhood

ps but my ranger is up to level 10.


-----Original Message-----
From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 11:37 AM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors


>From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
>very true, warriors become damage absorbtion machines.
>
>BUT, even tho I don't do near the over all damage, its still nice to see me
doing some damage, even if its minute compared to what the wiz is doing :)
>
>>>> "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...> 5.25.99 2:34:27 AM >>>
>From: "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...>
>
>Who cares what damage a warrior does at 35+
>That is not our role......suck it up...all of the damage.
>That is what you are here for.
>Try doin more damage then a wiz or a mate.....I think not.
>
>Warriors ar not the ones to dish out the damage....at lower levels yea but
>at higer levels we just keep em occupied.
>IMHO
>
>Vashi, Eternal warriors
>
>>>From: <slu@...>
>>
>>Tom
>>
>>Yup & the gap seems to get worse the higher in levels you go. Not only
>>Rangers, but Paladins & especially Monks seem to greatly diminish the role
>>of the warrior at levels 25+. Eventually the other classes have similar
>>(within a couple of 100 hps) stats and much more diversity in terms of
>>healing & hth damage capability. Mind you that my opinion is based on
>>talking with high level players (who have tried to convince me to dump my
>>warrior) & from reading on the eqstratics site.
>>
>>There is an interesting thread on the eqstratics board (warriors)
regarding
>>the perceived lack of differentiation (or all out weakness) of our class
at
>>higher levels.
>>
>>What does the rest of the list think? Anyone have direct experience
>>playing these classes at level 30+ & can compare HTH damage &
effectiveness
>>against critters?
>>
>>Rob Wilbarg aka Flair in Fennin Ro
>>
>> > ** Original Subject: [warriors_eq] Rangers and warriors
>> > ** Original Sender: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>> > ** Original Date: Mon, 24 May 1999 12:26:45 -0400
>>
>> > ** Original Message follows...
>>
>> >
>> > This past week I decided to take a break from my level 15 dark elf
>>warrior. I was abit frustrated.
>> >
>> > I started a half-elf warrior in Kelethin. It is insanely easy to play
>>there. I made level 5 in about 3.5 hours. Then I stopped and tried a
wood
>>elf ranger. Has anyone else played a ranger? I imagine it is the most
>>poorly balanced of all the hybrids. After 4 hours I reached level 5 and
>>got kick. I am now 12-18 hours into the character and almost level 9. I
>>am just as capable as an equivalent warrior. Next level I gain an array
of
>>spells which will boost my combat effectiveness and allow me to heal.
Part
>>of the easy success is the plethora of low level orcs available a stone's
>>throw from Kelethin. With my tracking ability I am never at a loss for
>>targets and I can engage blue con orcs in rapid succession or even 2 at a
>>time. I can even engage and successfully beat yellow con orcs more than
50%
>>of the time and almost always can kill orcs that con even to me without
>>trouble. So far it seems that I get as many hit points now as my warrior
>>did.
>> >
>> > My point is, with a ranger class as powerful a combatant as it is I see
>>little necessity for the pure warrior. I am going to play through to
level
>>15 I think, just to see a more even comparison. My concern is only from a
>>game mechanics perspective though as I have no doubt my playing as a dark
>>elf was a much more rewarding experience. Has anyone else noticed that
the
>>warrior just is not different enough from the hybrid fighter classes?
>> >
>> > Bael Aelyn
>> > Warrior of the 15th Order or Ranger of the 8th Rank
>> > Indigo Brotherhood Humble Servant of
>>Tunare
>> >
>> > still undecided
>> >
>>
>>
>> >** --------- End Original Message ----------- **
>>
>> >
>>
>>
>>
